page.title: 16Local History
page.content: The church is outside the village,near Milburn Beck.The building is an aggregation of structures of various ages, though the doorway is late Norman & similar masonry can be seen along the lower parts of the building on the S. side and scattered over other walls of the church. Milburn Mill was in use until 1925, but the dam has collapsed and the water conduit and the race ace in ruins. The Village green is an oblong measuring 800' by 250' and is surrounded by houses facing the green.In the past it is thought that in winter cattle were put onto the green for protection. The Maypole stands on what is thought to be the burial place of an ancient British chieftan.One Maypole was erected in 1875,and the present one in 1984.
